creator: belg4mit@pthbb.org
text:
I've copied my RewriteRule s and mod_roaming
setup from a 2.0.39 config and they are summarily
ignored by the 46. No errors on startup or runtime,
but URIs which should be redirected result in a 404.

creator: nd@perlig.de
text:
Your report lacks of useful information. What did you configure? Where? How?
What OS? etc.

creator: belg4mit@pthbb.org
text:
RedHat 9

Linux hostname 2.4.20-8 #1 Thu Mar 13 16:42:56 EST 2003 i586 i586
 i386 GNU/Linux

Reading specs from /usr/lib/gcc-lib/i386-redhat-linux/3.2.2/specs
Configured with: ../configure --prefix=/usr --mandir=/usr/share/man --infodir=/u
sr/share/info --enable-shared --enable-threads=posix --disable-checking --with-s
ystem-zlib --enable-__cxa_atexit --host=i386-redhat-linux
Thread model: posix
gcc version 3.2.2 20030222 (Red Hat Linux 3.2.2-5)

./configure --enable-proxy-http --enable-ext-filter --enable-headers --enable-cg
id --disable-userdir --enable-rewrite --enable-so --prefix=/opt/apache --enable-
mods-shared=all --with-mpm=worker --sysconfdir=/home/net/etc/

creator: belg4mit@pthbb.org
text:
Some examples of the problems I've run into
with this version:

Given the config at:
    http://pthbb.org/httpd.conf

It would seem that none of the following should happen
404 http://pthbb.org/software/tsalagi.html
403 http://pthbb.org/ocular/photos/
404 http://pthbb.org/roaming/

I've tried all manner of Redirect* and Rewrite*
for the first problem, and no idea what's wrong
with the second. The last is a 3rd party module
but due to the abnormal behavior elsewhere I
suspect the problem lies elsewhere.

Also, XBitHack is on and yet

http://pthbb.org/ is not parsed

-rwxr--r--    1 net      net          2016 Jun  8 00:10 
/home/net/httpd/html/index.html

SetEnv and CGI also seem to be mishandled.


        AddHandler cgi-script .cgi

is ignored. http://pthbb.org/env.cgi is mode 755, and works from the
prompt, but is sent for download. I actually ran into this when trying
to determine where the propagation of my SetEnv directive was breaking
down.
creator: belg4mit@pthbb.org

text:
This is almost surely a configuration error, because otherwise we'd have heard
many similar reports.

My suggestion: Start with the standard httpd.conf with absolutely minimum
changes to get it working on your site.  Then slowly add back the directives
you are having problems with until you can see exactly where it breaks.
creator: slive@apache.org
belg4mit@pthbb.org
text:
I have tried, with limited success to do so. However it appears to undergo
bitrot and lose some of the recovereed functionality. I had, for some time,
directory listings and mod_roaming working. Now neither is (with no changes
to config, hence bitrot). I had been using mod_roaming with 2.0.39 for nearly
a year (and I proxied everything else to 1.3.27) so I find it odd that
mod_roaming is having issues with 2.0.46... as I am apt to believe that
mod_roaming itself is quite stable. I fear I may have to revert to 1.3

In this whole report you haven't given near enough information to
reproduce any particular problem.  My suspicion is that you are
confusing several versions of apache and/or several config files.

But in any case, there is nothing we can do without a specific,
reproducable problem.  If you are still having problems, I suggest
you try the users@httpd.apache.org mailing list.  (But there again,
you will need to be much more specific and precise about what you
are doing and what is going wrong.)

Thanks for using Apache!
creator: slive@apache.org
